Class StringStats

  • java.lang.Object
    • StringStats

  • public class StringStats
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores the statistics for the given string. This includes the string, its length, the number of times it was typed, the average time it took to type the string, and the average duration of each character.
    Author:
    Tom

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StringStats(java.lang.String s)
      Creates a string statistics of the given string with a count of 0.
      StringStats(java.lang.String s, java.lang.Long[] durations, long totalDur)
      Creates a string statistics given the individual char durations and the total duration for the word.

    • Method Summary

      • getCharDuration

        public long getCharDuration(int index)
        Get the average time a character in the string was held down.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        average duration

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString()
        Get the string that stats are being provided for.
        Returns:
        the string

      • getTotalDuration

        public long getTotalDuration()
        Get the average total duration of the word. Note that the average total duration will not be equal to the individual characters. This is because sometimes people will not completely finish typing a character before typing another.
        Returns:
        average total time it takes to type the string

      • getStringCount

        public int getStringCount()
        How many times the string was typed.
        Returns:
        number of times the string was typed

      • getStringLength

        public int getStringLength()
        Get the length of the string.
        Returns:
        length of the string

      • average

        public void average(StringStats ss)
        Average another string stats object with this one.
        Parameters:
        ss - the other string stats
